radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is diffusely hypoattenuating, suggestive of hepatic steatosis, with ill-defined geographic hyperattenuating areas. The pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys are normal with no focal lesions. Mild hiatal hernia observed; the appendix is fluid-filled, distended to 1.6 cm, with bowel wall thickening and hyperemia and extensive surrounding fat stranding. Mildly prominent mesenteric lymph nodes in the right lower quadrant. No evidence of perforation.
